elements.description:
`furo-data-table`
Read only data table based on the response type from the rest api spec.


Custom property | Description | Default  | Fallback
----------------|-------------|----------|----------
`--furo-data-table-header-background` | Background color of the header row | --surface | white
`--furo-data-table-header-on-background` | Color of the header row | --on-surface | black
`--furo-data-table-background` | Background color of the element | --surface | white
`--furo-data-table-on-background` | Color of the element | --on-surface | black
`--data-table-separator` | Color of separator lines | --separator | rgba(0, 0, 0, .12)


Tags: data-ui

properties.name: cols
properties.description:
Column meta information
used to render all the column stuff

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Typedefinition of row items
REST SPEC Type
Supported __ui flags: "flags": ["align-right"] e.g. for numeric values
e.g. task.Task.[type]

properties.name: fields
properties.description:
list of fields which columns should be displayed
comma separated field list

properties.name: sortableFields
properties.description:
list of sortable fields
comma separated field list

properties.name: singleSelection
properties.description:
if True the single row selection mode is activated
No bulk action or checkboxes are available

properties.name: hideHead
properties.description: if True the header row is unvisible

methods.name: _checkType
methods.description:
SPEC Type checker
Builds the column Array for the inner template

methods.name: _applySortableFields
methods.description:
parses the attribute sortable-fields
and creates an internal array of sortable fields

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Triggers wire name --focus for internal use

methods.name: first
methods.description: Focuses the first table row element

methods.name: select
methods.description: Focuses the first table row element

methods.name: last
methods.description: Focuses the last table row element

methods.name: _focusRowByIndex
methods.description:
Comfort function to focus a specific table row
by index

events.description:
Fired when a row is checked or unchecked
Payload: Array of raw Entities

events.name: data-loaded
events.description:
Fired when inject data has successfully finished.
Payload: this

events.name: spec-error
events.description:
spec-error
Fired when spec could not be loaded
detail payload: {string} spec name

events.name: tablerow-selected
events.description:
Fired when a table row has been selected.
Payload: Entity

elements.description:
`furo-data-hide-content` hides content in dependency to a boolean field value. It is also possible to call the `hide()` and `show()` methods to show and hide the content and update the value. ```
some content
```

properties.name: _hidden
properties.description: Internal variable to update the attribute, which triggers the css

properties.name: hideOnFalse
properties.description: Hide element on false instead of true

methods.name: bindData
methods.description:
Bind a entity field to the date-input. You can use the entity even when no data was received.
When you use `@-object-ready` from a `furo-data-object` which emits a EntityNode, just bind the field with `--entity(*.fields.fieldname)`

methods.name: _checkInversedState
methods.description: inverses the bool based on hindOnFalse

elements.name: FuroDataHideContent

attributes.name: hide-on-false
attributes.description: Hide element on false instead of true

events.name: hided
events.description:
hided
Fired when the content gets hided

detail payload: void

events.name: showed
events.description:
showed
Fired when the content gets visible

detail payload: void

events.name: value-changed
events.description:
value-changed
Fired when the visibility changed

detail payload: {Boolean} current visibility state

elements.description:
`furo-chart-display`
 Component to display charts with apex charts(https://github.com/apexcharts/apexcharts.js).

 ```html
 <furo-chart-display chart-type="bar">
    <furo-data-chart-binder
        ƒ-bind-data="--projectDAO(*.entities)"
        data-field="data.cost_limit.units"
        category-field="data.description"
    ></furo-data-chart-binder>
 </furo-chart-display>
 ```

properties.name: sparkline
properties.description:
Hides all elements of the chart other than the primary graphic.
Use this to visualize data in very small areas.

properties.name: zebra
properties.description: set zebra color like zebra="#f3f4f5, #fff" to get stripes

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description:
Set the text to display, if no data is given.

If this option is not set, the default is **No data.**

properties.name: legend
properties.description: Enables the legend on bottom left with offset 0:0

properties.name: dataLabels
properties.description: Enable labels with data on every item.

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: show a tooltip on mouseover

properties.name: legendAlign
properties.description:
Aligns the legend to `left` `center` `right`

default is **left**

properties.name: legendPosition
properties.description:
Set the position of the legend to `top`, `right`, `bottom`, `left`

Default is **bottom**

properties.name: legendOffsetX
properties.description: Moves the legend in the **x** direction for n pixels from `legend-position`

properties.name: legendOffsetY
properties.description: Moves the legend in the **y** direction for n pixels from `legend-position`

properties.name: toolbar
properties.description: Enables the toolbar

properties.name: toolbarDownload
properties.description: Enables the download option in the toolbar (svg,csv,png)

properties.name: plotHorizontal
properties.description: Enable this to draw the bars horizontally

properties.name: grid
properties.description: Draw the horizontal grid lines

properties.name: chartType
properties.description:
line, area, bar are mixable

radar, scatter, heatmap

pie donut polarArea radialBar can only consume 1 data series

properties.name: stacked
properties.description:
WORK IN PROGRESS
Stacked bar charts are not mixable

properties.name: titleText
properties.description: Set the title.

properties.name: titleAlign
properties.description:
Aligns the title. Possible values are 'left', 'center', 'right'

Default is **left**

properties.name: titleOffsetX
properties.description: Moves the title for n pixels on the x-axis from the alignment direction

properties.name: titleOffsetY
properties.description: Moves the title for n pixels on the y-axis from the alignment direction

properties.name: fixedHeight
properties.description: Set a fixed height for the plot. Default is auto, this can be useful if you need to control the heights

events.name: data-point-clicked
events.description:
data-point-clicked
Fired when a marker for this data source was clicked
detail payload: Fieldnode

Note: the event is fired from the furo-data-chart-binder

elements.description:
`furo-data-chart-binder`
 Connects data objects (repeaterNodes) with the charting lib.

properties.name: chartType
properties.description:
Use this for mixed charts
Specify the default type on the display and set the custom type on this binder

methods.name: _convertData
methods.description:
Prepares the data for the according chart display

some charts want 1 dimensional data (pie, donut) and others expect more dimensions (boxplot,...)

methods.name: _pathGet
methods.description:
Reads a value from a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method returns `undefined` (will never throw.

params.name: root
params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc:
Value at path, or `undefined` if the path could not be
 fully dereferenced.

elements.name: FuroDataChartBinder

attributes.name: chart-type
attributes.description:
Use this for mixed charts
Specify the default type on the display and set the custom type on this binder

events.name: data-point-clicked
events.description:
data-point-clicked
Fired when a marker for this data source was clicked
detail payload: Fieldnode

events.name: data-updated
events.description:
data-updated
Fired when datasource has updated data
detail payload: data-series

elements.description:
`furo-data-context-menu`
 A  [material design](https://material.io/components/menus/) context menu or menu element.

 You have to put a `furo-data-context-menu-display` element in one of the parent elements of the element where you use the `furo-data-context-menu`.
 The app-shell is a good place for that.

```html
 <furo-data-context-menu condensed position="below" ƒ-trigger="--menuClkd" ƒ-bind-data="--menuObject" @-menu-item-selected="--menuItem">
     <furo-icon-button icon="menu" @-click="--menuClkd"></furo-icon-button>
 </furo-data-context-menu>
```

properties.name: _context
properties.description: Use this to set a string value as context.

properties.name: condensed
properties.description: set this for condensed mode.

methods.name: bindData
methods.description: Bind your menu object with the signature of menu.Menuitem or [menu.Menuitem].

methods.name: setContext
methods.description: Sets the context. Use this if you want to set a Object as context

params.name: ctx
params.description: {*} Can be anything, will be returned at the menu-item-selected method

methods.name: trigger
methods.description: Triggers the context menu. Set by keyboard to true to focus the first element for keyboard navigation

elements.name: FuroDataContextMenu

attributes.name: condensed
attributes.description: set this for condensed mode.

events.name: menu-item-selected
open-furo-data-menu-requested

elements.description:
`furo-data-context-menu-item` is a helper component for `furo-data-context-menu`.

Use [`furo-data-context-menu`](?t=FuroDataContextMenu) to show a context menu.

properties.name: focused
properties.description: focused state

methods.name: _openSub
methods.description: send event to open the submenu

methods.name: _closeSub
methods.description: The submenu item was set from the _openSub() event response

methods.name: _selectItem
methods.description: Select the item, furo-data-context-menu callback will be called

methods.name: select
methods.description: selects the item if it does not have child elements

methods.name: _mouseSelect
methods.description: Open the item if it have children

methods.name: index
methods.description: store the index for mouseover focus

opensub-requested

detail payload:

elements.description:
FOR DOCUMENTATION PURPOSES ONLY

Base filter is the base element to build special filter comparator fields
Your element is then bindable with type filter.Comparator

 after binding with .. a wire --filternode is triggered

 ### internal hooks
 #### --clear
 Use this to clear the filter val and is.
elements.summary: base component to make a bindable filter

properties.name: comparators
properties.description:
Semicolon separated list of acceptable comparators.

like: gt, lt

properties.name: defaultComparator
properties.description: set this to init with this comparator or set the comparator to this value on clear

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label for the input

properties.name: hideComparator
properties.description: hide the comparator dropdown

properties.name: hideClear
properties.description: hide the clear

elements.description:
`furo-data-filter-date`
Date element bindable with type filter.Condition

```
<date-filter
 hide-clear
 condensed
 ƒ-bind-filter-condition="--filteDO(*.due_date)"
></date-filter>
```

elements.description:
INITIAL VERSION

`furo-data-filter-slot`
 Throw in any component to use it as a filter

 The component must emit a **value-changed** event with the value you want to have in the condition

 The component can emit a **clear** event to clear the filter

 The values of the component are not updated from this component. You have to do an additional binding by yourself if needed.
 Do not forget that the condition value always comes as a string, when binding to your component.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label for the input

properties.name: hideComparator
properties.description: hide the comparator dropdown

properties.name: hideClear
properties.description: hide the clear
